data:
T1 stage corresponds to a tumor size of 2 cm or less.
T2 stage corresponds to a tumor size of more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm.
T3 stage corresponds to a tumor with a largest diameter more than 5 cm.
T4 stage corresponds to a tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and/or the skin.
The T stage is determined by the size of the primary tumor.

T1 stage corresponds to a tumor size of 2 cm or less.
T2 stage corresponds to a tumor size of more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm.
T3 stage corresponds to a tumor with a largest diameter more than 5 cm.
T4 stage corresponds to a tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and/or the skin.
The T stage is determined by the size of the primary tumor and/or its invasion of the chest wall and/or skin.

T1 stage corresponds to a tumor size of 2 cm or less.
T2 stage corresponds to a tumor size of more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm.
T3 stage corresponds to a tumor with a largest diameter more than 5 cm.
T4 stage corresponds to a tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and/or the skin.
The T stage is determined by the size of the primary tumor and/or its invasion of the chest wall and/or skin.
T1 is further divided into T1mi, T1a, T1b, and T1c based on tumor size and other factors. The report does not provide enough information to determine these substages.

T1 stage corresponds to a tumor size of 2 cm or less.
T2 stage corresponds to a tumor size of more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm.
T3 stage corresponds to a tumor with a largest diameter more than 5 cm.
T4 stage corresponds to a tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and/or the skin.
The T stage is determined by the size of the primary tumor and/or its invasion of the chest wall and/or skin.
T1 is further divided into T1mi, T1a, T1b, and T1c based on tumor size and other factors. The report does not provide enough information to determine these substages.
The absence of direct extension to the chest wall and/or skin indicates that the T stage is either T1, T2, or T3.
The presence of vascular invasion does not affect the T stage.

T1 stage corresponds to a tumor size of 2 cm or less.
T2 stage corresponds to a tumor size of more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm.
T3 stage corresponds to a tumor with a largest diameter more than 5 cm.
T4 stage corresponds to a tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and/or the skin.
The T stage is determined by the size of the primary tumor and/or its invasion of the chest wall and/or skin.
T1 is further divided into T1mi, T1a, T1b, and T1c based on tumor size and other factors. The report does not provide enough information to determine these substages.
The absence of direct extension to the chest wall and/or skin indicates that the T stage is either T1, T2, or T3.
The presence of vascular invasion does not affect the T stage.
AJCC/UICC stage: pT1cN1MX indicates that the T stage is T1c, but the report does not provide enough information to determine this substage.
